comment.author: 57210431@N02
comment._content: A very nice shot, great work

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content: Could it be Count Plunkett 3rd row second from left (with beard) and Erskine Childers 3rd row fifth from right, that is third on left  of tallest man? In front row 3rd from right beside Harry Boland, as identified by Decsramble, seems to be Arthur Griffith

comment.author: 54082333@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69587809@N05] Yeah that's Plunkett. Arthur Griffith wouldnt have been there since we're pretty sure this is an Anti-Treaty gathering, I think the guy you are talking about is Sean T O'Kelly? Erskine Childers is a good catch though, the guy in the middle? I've added a note on him. Here is another picture with him in a similar stance calitreview.com/2408

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content: Thanks decsramble: Glad we agree on Count Plunkett. I hadn't seen the full picture before commenting rightly on Childers and very wrongly on Griffith rather than Sean T O'Kelly. That's part of the fun. I saw your interest on the women, so turn your attention to the 'workers' pictures when you have time

comment.author: 69587809@N05
comment._content: Could it be Gerald Boland in second row first on right?

comment.author: 92695422@N03
comment._content: Descramble. That is definitely Erskine Childers ( my great-grandfather). Cheers.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92695422@N03] Thanks very much for adding those notes!
